location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.167 of 1856 from Commander Felix Jones, Acting Resident in the Persian Gulf, to Henry Anderson, Secretary to the Government of Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter relates to ongoing attempts to obtain compensation form Shaikh Sultan ben Suggar [Sultan bin Saqr] for the goods plundered by his subjects from a shipwrecked vessel at Sharjah. The letter describes Shaikh Sultanâ€™s acceptance to pay compensation, the level of compensation set, the culpability of the residents of Sharjah in the plunder, the extent of the damage to the shipwrecked vessel.
